Package chess

Class Board

  • java.lang.Object
    • chess.Board
  • public class Board
extends java.lang.Object
    Board is a representation of the current state of the game board. 8x8 grid of Squares that contain chess pieces.
    Author:
    Vincent Phung, William McFarland

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field Description
      chess.Square[][] board  

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      Board()
      Class constructor to create a new board instance.

    • Field Detail

      • board

        public chess.Square[][] board

    • Constructor Detail

      • Board

        public Board()
        Class constructor to create a new board instance. Initializes board with 8x8 squares and puts pieces on the board.

    • Method Detail

      • printBoard

        public void printBoard()
        Prints out all of the squares on the board.

      • canMove

        public boolean canMove​(chess.Square curSquare,
                       chess.Square destSquare)
        Determines whether the piece on the currently selected square can move to the destination square successfully. Does not check if the move puts their King in check.
        Parameters:
        curSquare - The currently selected square.
        destSquare - The destination square that the user wants to move to.
        Returns:
        true if the piece on curSquare can successfully move to destSquare.

      • getSquares

        public java.util.ArrayList<chess.Square> getSquares​(java.lang.String color)
        Gets the squares of a selected color.
        Parameters:
        color - Color of the squares to search for.
        Returns:
        List of squares of a specific color.

      • getEnpassant

        public chess.Square getEnpassant()
        Accessor method that returns the current Enpassant square.
        Returns:
        enpassant or NULL if there is no current enpassant square

      • setEnpassant

        public void setEnpassant​(chess.Square piece)
        Mutator method that changes the enpassant field to the parameter.
        Parameters:
        piece - Square representing the new Enpassant

      • isUnderAttack

        public boolean isUnderAttack​(chess.Square curSquare,
                             java.lang.String enemyColor)
        Method that determines whether the Square curSquare would be able to be attacked by a piece of enemyColor
        Parameters:
        curSquare - The Square in question
        enemyColor - The color of the enemy/opponent
        Returns:
        true if curSquare can be attacked or false otherwise
